basics.name: Anne Branum-Jiao
basics.title: Clinical Research Scientist
basics.summary: Results-oriented Scientist with 6+ years of experience bridging biomedical research and analytics, specializing in preclinical cancer research and immunology. Proficient in leveraging analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, PowerBI, and Tableau for data-driven insights and predictive modeling in multidisciplinary contexts. Expert in designing, executing, and troubleshooting complex experiments with a strong foundation in molecular biology, genetics, and cell biology. Skilled in synthesizing research findings into actionable data visualizations and statistical analyses, contributing significantly to clinical study publications. Demonstrates exceptional ability in cross-disciplinary collaboration, ensuring comprehensive data integration, analysis, and compliance with scientific standards. Adept at organizing and communicating complex data sets to foster information sharing and support strategic decision-making in research projects.

work.name: Audie L. Murphy VA Hospital/UTHSCSA
work.summary: Provided technical support, developed analytics dashboards, and assisted in various aspects of research publication and grant writing.
highlights: Developed dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau for cohort demographics and budget management
Designed figures for publications from R using Adobe Illustrator
Assisted in grant writing, experimental design, and SOP development

work.name: Molecular Templates
work.summary: Oversaw lab notebook system integration, wrote IND filing, designed experiments, and analyzed datasets using various tools.
highlights: Managed Benchling lab notebook system integration
Developed protocols and trained new lab personnel
Analyzed datasets using SQL, Python, R, and Prism

work.name: Audie L. Murphy VA Hospital/UTHSCSA
work.summary: Conducted clinical immunology and infectious disease research, focusing on various conditions using advanced laboratory techniques.
highlights: Researched Covid-19, HIV, AIDS, allergy, and asthma using flow cytometry, ELISA, qPCR, and cytokine multiplex
Analyzed results using flowjo and automated tasks with Python
Managed patient sample processing, storage, and logging

work.name: UTSA/SwRI
work.summary: Conducted research on active galaxies and tested imaging hardware for space applications.
highlights: Developed an online database for active galactic nuclei (AGN) observations
Used web scraping in Python to catalog galaxy information
Tested and optimized imaging hardware for satellite use

education.institution: University of Texas at San Antonio, Honors College

publications.name: Immunologic resilience and COVID-19 survival advantage
publications.publisher: Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology

publications.name: Large-scale provocation studies identify maladaptive responses to ubiquitous aeroallergens as a correlate of severe allergic rhinoconjunctivitis and asthma
